name: Virtual Harmonica
description:
This is just a simple little harmonica simulation for you to play with. It was built with Unity, and the sounds were recorded from a cheap 10-hole diatonic "C" harmonica I bought online. You mostly play it with just the mouse, but you can use keys if you want to get fancy. It sounds more like a piano than a real harmonica, because it is not a real one. But at least you can learn your favorite songs, or write your own, and know exactly how to play them on a real harmonica later.

Controls:

Mouse left/right = Move harmonica

Mouse up/down = bend note

Mouse wheel = Scroll up to blow, scroll down to draw

1, 2, 3 keys = bend pitch by number of semitones indicated on the key you hold down

Tab = activate Free Bend (allows you to bend notes you wouldn't be able to on a regular harmonica)

Q key = quit
